meanings.definition: A small lizard with soft skin, large eyes, and adhesive pads on its feet.
meanings.sent1: Geckos are small lizards that can climb walls with their sticky feet.
meanings.sent2: I saw geckos crawling on the walls of the old house.
meanings.sent3: The geckos in the garden seemed to be having a race up the tree.
meanings.sent4: The geckos' ability to stick to surfaces is like having tiny suction cups on their feet.
meanings.sent5: The geckos' eyes were as big as marbles, making them look quite adorable.

meanings.definition: To make a fool of; to mock or ridicule.
meanings.sent1: Don't geckos your friends by teasing them too much.
meanings.sent2: The bullies would often geckos the new students at school.
meanings.sent3: He tried to geckos his little sister by pretending to be a ghost.
meanings.sent4: Her sarcastic remarks would geckos anyone who took her seriously.
meanings.sent5: The comedian would geckos himself in front of the audience to make them laugh.
